alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued April 25 at 4:40AM EDT until April 25 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Fresh easterly breezes across the northeast Gulf last night churned up the waters. Franklin County beaches will be open to the surf and high rip current risk that the east winds kicked up.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
